entry.title: Crypto World On Edge: Bidenâ€™s Tax Regulation Draws Sharp Criticism
entry.summary:
United States President Joe Bidenâ€™s proposed cryptocurrency tax regulations are causing concern among many. These regulations would require brokers (individuals facilitating buying and selling) to report digital currency transactions to the government, aligning with existing practices for other monetary transactions.Â
However, these rules are facing opposition within the cryptocurrency community. Critics argue that these stringent measures could stifle innovation and progress within the US.
Ryan Selkis, CEO of Messari, is a vocal opponent of this concept. He predicts unfavorable outcomes for the US cryptocurrency industry if Biden is reelected.Â
Thereâ€™s no future for crypto in the US if Biden is reelected. Iâ€™m sorry.
Move abroad, draft Newsom and hope for the best, or vote GOP â€¦

entry.title: Only 2 % of Russians Ready to Keep All Their Savings in Digital Ruble: Poll
entry.summary:
While over half of Russians are willing to put some money into their nationâ€™s digital ruble, only 2% say they would keep all their savings in it. Insufficient information and fear of system failures are among the biggest factors turning people away from the government-issued digital currency.
Nearly a Quarter of Russians Would Store Less Than $200 in State-Issued Digital Ruble
More than half of Russian citizens aged 18 to 65 are ready to keep money in the central bank digital currency (CBDC) issued by the Bank of Russia, a survey among 2,000 people ordered by the Russian SPB Exchange has shown.
According to the results, quoted by the Russian daily Izvestia on Thursday, almost a quarter of the respondents said they would convert between 5,000 and 20,000 regular rubles (approximately â€¦

The high-ranking official added that at this point in time it would be premature to name those in the next batch of candidates.
BRICS and Its New Members Need Time Before Next Expansion Wave, Moscow Says
All of the newly invited countries have reaffirmed their desire to join BRICS, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov said at a press conference after the organizationâ€™s 15th annual summit which was held on Aug. 22-24 in South Africa.
At their meeting in Johannesburg, the current five member states (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) agreed to admit six more nations as members of the group oâ€¦

entry.title: Indian Official: De-Dollarization Remains Distant, Rupee Should Become Dominant Currency
entry.summary:
Indiaâ€™s oil and gas minister says de-dollarization is a long way away. The official emphasized his desire to conduct all transactions in rupees, expressing his wish for the Indian currency to become â€œthe lead currency in the world.â€
Indian Official on De-Dollarization
Indiaâ€™s Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri stated in an interview with CNBC on the sidelines of the B20 Summit in New Delhi on Friday that de-dollarization is a long way off.
Puri explained that he expects the U.S. dollar to maintain its dominance in global trade. Commenting on factors that could dethrone the USD as the worldâ€™s reserve currency, he opined:
I donâ€™t know what kind of change [the dollar needs to] be affected but I donâ€™t see it â€¦ Itâ€™s not so easy.
The minister further shared that he does not see the Indian rupee challenging the U.S. dollar as a major global currency, even though it is being used in some oil transactions alongside the Chinese yuan and the Russian ruble. Nonetheless, he stressed:
I would like to be able to transact everything in rupees â€¦ I wish the Indian rupee should be the lead currency in the world. But Iâ€™m also a realist.
A growing number of countries are moving away from settlements in U.S. dollars. The BRICS nations (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa), for example, are encouraging the use of local currencies in international trade and financial transactions.
While acknowledging a growing de-dollarization trend, the Indian minister questioned: â€œThe main point is that â€¦ there are arrangements, but the transactions which are taking place, how many percent is coming in rupees?â€ He noted: â€œWe heard about decoupling. But these international arrangements, trading arrangements, payment arrangements, these have been in place for a long time.â€
Do you agree with the Indian official about de-dollarization? Let us know in the comments section below.

entry.title: US Dollar Dominance in Global Payments Strengthens, SWIFT Data Shows
entry.summary:
The U.S. dollarâ€™s dominance in global payments has strengthened, according to data compiled by global financial messaging service SWIFT. The share of SWIFT FX transactions involving the U.S. dollar rose to a record 46% in July. In addition, the share of the transactions involving the Chinese yuan has increased.
SWIFT Data Indicates US Dollar Dominance
The dominance of the U.S. dollar in international payments has reached a record high, according to the latest transaction data from the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT), the leading global financial messaging service. SWIFTâ€™s messaging platform, products, and services connect more than 11,000 banking and securities organizations, market infrastructures, and corporate customers in more than 200 countries â€¦

Binance Node Growing Rapidly
According to data from the analytics platform Amboss, Binanceâ€™s lightning node has been growing rapidly. The exchange is currently ranked 14th based on capacity, boasting 77.7 BTC out of the networkâ€™s total of 4,873.39 BTC.Â Â
This means that Binanceâ€™s integration of the Lightning Network has been well-received, and Binance users are actively using the Binance lightning node to process their Bitcoin transactions.
This milestone comes after a report alleged tâ€¦

entry.title: Heatwave and Debt: Laos Suspends Crypto Mining Operations Amid Rising Power Demands
entry.summary:
In recent developments, Electricite du Laos (EDL) announced on August 24 that the power company shut down cryptocurrency mining activities. This decision came after this summerâ€™s unprecedented heat surge escalated electricity demands. Furthermore, these mining operations have reportedly been defaulting on their debts.
Laosâ€™ Crypto Mining Grinds to a Halt Amid Energy Crisis
Situated in Southeast Asia, Laos, surrounded by nations like Myanmar, China, Vietnam, Cambodia, and Thailand, has reportedly halted its crypto mining. Interestingly, Laos relies on hydropower for a significant 95% of the countryâ€™s electricity generation.
Over the first half of 2023, EDLâ€™s hydropower stations have been overwhelmed with electricity consumption. The scorching heat is a major factor driving this soaring demand. But thatâ€™s not all; the Laos government states that regional mining activities havenâ€™t cleared their dues. Notably, Laos has been increasingly open to cryptocurrency operations since 2021.
As highlighted by Vietnam Plus, back in September 2021, the Laotian government green-lighted six companies to dive into crypto mining and trading. Fast forward to January 2022, the Bank of Laos endorsed two crypto trading platforms, Lao Digital Assets Exchange (LDX) and Bitqik, setting them apart as the nationâ€™s sole regulated entities offering comprehensive cryptocurrency services.
By May 2022, Laos inaugurated a dedicated cryptocurrency mining venture in its Champasack Province. This landmark event was spearheaded by Lao Crypto Mining in collaboration with AIF Group. As of August 2022, projections showed Laos raking in nearly $190 million in tax revenues from crypto-related operations by yearâ€™s end. However, the recent shutdown report leaves us in the dark about its duration and the outstanding amount owed by the mining businesses.
What do you think about the mining shutdown in Laos? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

The scam unfolded when an observant on-chain character detected a transaction that would set the stage for the grand deception. Employing a tactic known as â€œaddress poisoning,â€ the scammer capitalized on the initial five and concluding four characters of the US Marshals Serviceâ€™s account, mirroring them in a counterfeit crypto wallet.Â

entry.title: How AI Could Lead To Discriminatory Hiring Practices
entry.summary: Recruiting-oriented AI tools aim to use applicant computer and cellphone cameras to analyze facial movements, speaking voice, and other parameters to create what it calls an â€œemployabilityâ€ score.

entry.title: Germany Ramps Up AI Investments Amid Global Race for Innovation
entry.summary: The German government has significantly boosted AI research funding, signaling its ambition to remain a key player in the global tech arena.

entry.title: FTX Estate Wants to Hedge Bitcoin, Ethereum With Mike Novogratz's Galaxy Digital
entry.summary: FTX wants to also sell and stake some of its crypto, hedging the company from â€œextreme and unpredictable price movements,â€ says a new filing.

entry.title: Central African Republic Eyes Tokenizing Its Natural Resources
entry.summary: Even though Bitcoin is no longer legal tender, the country remains committed to crypto.

entry.title: NVIDIA Rides AI Boom to Record-Setting Revenue
entry.summary: The company's data center and gaming products also boosted the bottom line.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Ryan Ozawa

entry.title: Dogecoin Millionaire's Fortune Fell From $3M to $50,000â€”But He Hasnâ€™t Lost the Faith
entry.summary: â€˜SlumDOGE Millionaireâ€™ Glauber Contessoto still believes in the popular memecoin.

entry.title: Patrick Mahomes Can't Quit Crypto
entry.summary: The NFL superstar is bucking the current trend of mega-celebrities avoiding the beleaguered crypto industry at all costs.

entry.title: The future of AI Stardom and Robotics with SingularityNET COO Janet Adams and Desdemona
entry.summary: In this interview, SingularityNET COO Janet Adams explains the intricate details that went into creating the Desdemona robot AI from Hanson Robotics and future plans for the AI Diva.

entry.title: Crypto a 'No-Brainer' for Video Games, Says Mino Games CEO
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha MacKinnon, developer of the upcoming Dimensionals game, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the studio's approach to digital collectibles.

entry.title: Michael Wagner's 'Controversial Take' on Crypto in Games
entry.summary: At Solana's PlayGG, Star Atlas CEO Michael Wagner shares his "controversial take" on crypto in games, shares the challenges of developing the upcoming scifi game, and how crypto's volatility has changed his perspective with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.

entry.title: Interview: Angelic CEO on Building the Sci-Fi RPG on Solana and Ethereum
entry.summary: Angelic is a sci-fi roleplay game in development that will be free-to-play and offer optional, opt-in crypto features on Solana and Ethereum and a governance token. Metaverse Game Studios CEO and Founder Erkan Bayol tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he sees AAA traditional games as Angelic's main competitors and shares his vision for the game.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor on AI's Impact on Video Games
entry.summary: Ben Prendergast is an actor who has voiced characters like Apex Legends' Fuse, God of War Ragnarok's Tyr, and Patroclus in Hades. But as debates swirl around the use of artificial intelligence in entertainment in light of the SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes, Prendergast gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin his honest take on the potential use of AI actors in games.

entry.title: Star Atlas CEO on Developing an MMO Game
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson speaks with Star Atlas Founder and CEO Michael Wagner about the MMO game's approach to development, marketing, and blockchain integrations.

entry.title: Aurory's Origin Story: How JRPGs Inspired the Games
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson talks to Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development Michael Natoli about the origins of the Aurory crypto games at the Solana PlayGG event.

entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Gameâ€™s Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallelâ€™s closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mashup
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mashup of Titanfall and Destiny.

entry.title: 'Give Projects a Chance,' Says Aurory's Michael Natoli on NFT Game Challenges
entry.summary: Aurory is an NFT-driven game franchise that started life on Solana and is expanding to other chains. Decrypt's Jason Nelson spoke with Aurory Head of Marketing Michael Natoli at Solana's PlayGG event, where Natoli shared his thoughts on the challenges that blockchain games face in reaching players.

entry.title: Solana Is Only Network Ready for Gaming: Solana Foundation's Johnny Lee
entry.summary: Solana Foundation General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Solana network will tackle the scaling problem that blockchain games pose for the industry.
